title: The different types of body fat
content: Subcutaneous fat = fat between the skin and the fascia. Visceral fat = fat beneath the fascia near the vital organs. Visceral fat is incredibly associated with metabolic disease. Although there are no standard reference ranges for visceral fat, in healthy individuals, values are generally less than 1 kg for younger individuals and between 1-2 kg for older individuals.

title: Tracking visceral fat
content: In an ideal world, rather than tracking our BF%, we would instead track what % of our fat was visceral fat.

title: Using MRI to see visceral fat
content: MRI is able to see visceral fat. Itâ€™s also non-invasive, no radiation. But again, not practical from a cost and availability standpoint as of today.
